newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIA'S LITHUN TO PAY DIVIDEND, BOOST CAPITAL.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIA'S LITHUN TO PAY DIVIDEND, BOOST CAPITAL.

text.p: Road building materials producer LITHUN said on Tuesday it will pay 0.035 litas per share in dividends and will boost its share capital by 2.4 million litas.
"The general shareholders' meeting decided to pay 0.035 litas per share with face value of one litas," Gintaras Gliozhaitis, the head of LITHUN brokerage house, told Reuters.
The shareholder meeting was on Friday.
Gliozhaitis also said that the shareholders' meeting decided to boost the company's share capital to 10.32 million litas from 7.9 million litas from its reserves.
The company reported earlier that its net profit rose to 1.08 million litas in 1996 versus 221,660 litas a year before.
The company also said its assets at the end of 1996 was 20.7 million litas.
It also said its turnover in 1996 was 36.57 million litas.
LITHUN is listed on Vilnius bourse's Group A.
